coverageText:
In days of yore, when time did weave its threads,
A tale doth linger 'midst the whispers fair,
Of an heirloom most rare, whose gleaming spread
Did lighten homes with glist’ring, hallowed air.

Fair was this jewel, crafted by the hand
Of ancient artisans with skill divine;
'Twas said a blessing from some distant land
Had set within its heart a mystic sign.

The lineage proud, whose name adorned its grace,
Of noble birth, in high esteem was held.
Yet fate's capricious winds did swiftly chase
The trinket forth, where shadows dark do dwell.

Lady Elsinore, with eyes of azure light,
Upon her neck the precious gem did wear,
But lo, on tempest's night, ‘twas hid from sight,
An heirloom lost, and left the house in care.

And thus commenced the quest to find anew
The gem of old, lest history fade in gloom.
Sir Cedric bold, with heart so staunch and true,
Did vow to seek the bauble's radiant bloom.

Through forest dim and over moorland drear,
He traveled swift with courage in his breast,
Till destiny beheld him drawing near
A wizened seer, whose visage none could jest.

"Seek not the jewel on this earthly plane,
For it resides within thy spirit's core.
In thy pure heart its glimmer shall remain,
As love shines brighter than all gems of yore."

Thus spake the mystic, in a voice so clear,
And knowledge wise did gently take its throne.
For the heirloom lost had ne'er departed near,
But lived in lore, where cherished love is sown.

So ends the tale of treasure now re-found,
In bonds of kin and life’s eternal ring;
The jewel's legacy shall e’er resound,
As tales of love through time immortal sing.
